intro: Exostema parviflorum subsp. eggersii, commonly known as the Eggers' narrowleaf strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
